block.p: DeBOW-Jean, daughter of Ms. Louise DeBow, departed this life on June 17, 2000 at Lutheran Medical Center, after a tragic car accident. Jean was the Vice President of the New York State Public Employees Federation, AFL-CIO, which represents 54,000 Professional, Scientific and Technical Workers, most of whom work in State Government Agencies throughout New York. Jean also served as the National Vice President of the Coalition of Labor Union Women and member of the Coalition of Black Trade Unionists. Viewing will be at Woodward Funeral Home, Wednesday, June 21, 2000, 2:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m., 1 Troy Avenue at Fulton Street, Brooklyn, New York. Funeral services will be held on Thursday, June 22, 2000 at 10:00 a.m. at Holy Trinity Baptist Church, 10 Ralph Avenue, Brooklyn, New York. Interment will be at Rosedale Cemetery, Linden, N.J.

Jean also served as the National Vice President of the Coalition of Labor Union Women and member of the Coalition of Black Trade Unionists. Viewing will be at Woodward Funeral Home, Wednesday, June 21, 2000, 2:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m., 1 Troy Avenue at Fulton Street, Brooklyn, New York. Funeral services will be held on Thursday, June 22, 2000 at 10:00 a.m. at Holy Trinity Baptist Church, 10 Ralph Avenue, Brooklyn, New York. Interment will be at Rosedale Cemetery, Linden, N.J.
